intro: Stachyopogon pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered stachyopogon, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
